metadata.title: CVE-2022-1055 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free exists in the Linux Kernel in tc_new_tfilter that couldallow a local attacker to gain privilege escalation. The exploit requiresunprivileged user namespaces. We recommend upgrading past commit04c2a47ffb13c29778e2a14e414ad4cb5a5db4b5

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1055` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1079-fips - 4.4.0-1079.86
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1079-fips - 4.4.0-1079.86
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1079-fips - 4.4.0-1079.86
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1079-fips - 4.4.0-1079.86
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
